description: Amazon Linux 2 CIS Benchmark v3.0.0 - Section 2.3 Configure Service Clients

controls.title: Ensure ftp client is not installed
controls.description: The ftp package provides the client programs for initiating FTP sessions to remote systems. The ftp protocol is insecure and unencrypted.
controls.remediation: Run the following command to remove the ftp package: # yum remove ftp

controls.title: Ensure ldap client is not installed
controls.description: The Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) was introduced as a replacement for NIS/YP. It is a service that provides a method for looking up information from a central database.
controls.remediation: Run the following command to remove the openldap-clients package: # yum remove openldap-clients

controls.title: Ensure nis client is not installed
controls.description: The Network Information Service (NIS) is a client-server directory service protocol used to distribute system configuration files. The NIS service is inherently an insecure system.
controls.remediation: Run the following command to remove the ypbind package: # yum remove ypbind

controls.title: Ensure telnet client is not installed
controls.description: The telnet package contains the telnet client, which allows users to start connections to other systems via the telnet protocol. The telnet protocol is insecure and unencrypted.
controls.remediation: Run the following command to remove the telnet package: # yum remove telnet

controls.title: Ensure tftp client is not installed
controls.description: Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP) is a simple protocol for exchanging files between two TCP/IP machines. TFTP does not have built-in encryption, access control or authentication.
controls.remediation: Run the following command to remove the tftp package: # yum remove tftp
